name: K2-60
scenarioDescription:
The K2-60 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-60 is a star with 0.97 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.12 times its radius. It is located 1626.5399719999998 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 10 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-60 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-60 system

K2-60 b

K2-60 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the Transit method. The mass of K2-60 b is 135.39558 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-60 b is 7.656 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-60 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, K2-60 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-60, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
